report_title: Industry Report on Frozen Cake and Pastry Manufacturing
executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers endured challenging conditions over the five years to 2024. Swelling health consciousness, changing consumer tastes and competition from fresh bakery items have hampered demand for traditional frozen cake and pastry products. In response to these trends, frozen cake and pastry manufacturers have focused on reformulating existing dessert selections with healthier, higher-quality ingredients. Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers also experimented with new flavor combinations while launching single-serving varieties that appeal to a wider range of health-conscious consumers. Despite major efforts to revitalize the frozen baked desserts market, frozen cake and pastry manufacturers have continued to contend with tepid demand from consumers and intensifying competition from other industries. That's why industry revenue will only inch up at a CAGR of 0.1% to an estimated $7.5 billion over the past five years, including a projected boost of 0.6% in 2024. The prices of key inputs like wheat, flour and milk have strengthened over the past five years, pushing up purchase costs for most frozen cake and pastry manufacturers and preventing profit expansion. Overall, average profit is expected to be 1.2% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Frozen cake and pastry producers having navigated changing consumer preferences with innovative products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Unfavorable shifts in consumer tastes and health concerns have negatively impacted the performance of frozen cakes and pastries over the last five years. In response, these producers have focused on developing new health-focused products using superior ingredients and providing smaller portions of high-calorie items.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Quality and flavor typically win over nutritional content
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite boosted consumer awareness regarding health risks, companies focusing on premium ingredients and exciting flavors have fared far better than those focusing merely on improving nutritional content.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Sustainability and ethical practices are gaining traction
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Sustainable sourcing and ethical practices are also emerging as important factors that influence consumer choices, offering brands an opportunity to enhance their reputation and appeal.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Smaller portion desserts will continue to gain popularity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Smaller-portion desserts draw health-conscious consumers, providing a compromise between full flavor and controlled calorie intake. Innovations in packaging and presentation for small-portion desserts attract consumers who also value aesthetics and quality.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The future of frozen cakes and pastries industry will be focused on preserving taste and nutrition
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for frozen cakes and pastries is governed by three key factors: value, convenience and taste. Advancements in freezing, processing and packaging technology have been game changers, allowing the preservation of taste and texture effectively.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: US dessert exports will see a bright future as many companies leverage market preferences and value opportunities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Exports in the dessert industry will strengthen, driven by the decreasing value of the US dollar and the rising industry presence overseas. Despite the drop in the US dollar's value, imports are expected to remain relatively strong because of rebounding demand for imported dessert products.

industry_definition: This industry produces various frozen sweet bakery products, such as soft cakes, cheesecakes, doughnuts, pies and cookies. The focus is on offering a wide range of treats catering to diverse consumer tastes and preferences.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income

key_trends: Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers endure intense competition in inputs, packaging, marketing and pricing. Strong supplier relationships are crucial. Perceived quality drives pricing, with branded products often commanding higher prices because of their presumed superior quality.

External competition arises from supermarkets with in-house bakeries, independent bakeries and imports from Canada and Mexico. Maintaining competitiveness requires securing optimal shelf space at retail outlets.
Consumers prioritize flavor over nutrition in frozen pastry choices, focusing on premium ingredients and unique tastes. Sara Lee Frozen Bakery's Perfect Pairings pies exemplify this trend.
Sustainability and ethical practices increasingly influence purchase decisions, with eco-friendly packaging and non-GMO certifications gaining popularity.

The trend toward smaller-portion desserts is expanding because of affordability, health concerns and novel flavors. Technological advances and demand for convenience and natural ingredients bolstered the frozen cakes and pastries market.

One frozen cake and pastry manufacturer holds at least 5.0% of the industry's market share, but this key player doesn't dominate industry revenue. The market shows low concentration, underscoring diverse competition.

Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers often make acquisitions to drive sustainability efforts. To reduce plastic waste, Conagra Brands aims for all its plastic to be compostable, recyclable or renewable by 2025.

The USDA and FDA regulate frozen cake and pastry manufacturers through various acts, ensuring truthful labeling and ingredient safety. The EPA and OSHA oversee environmental impacts and worker safety in the industry.

The NFRA and AFFI collaborate to promote the Frozen Cake and Pastry Manufacturing industry, offering resources, marketing and lobbying efforts. During COVID-19, the US government introduced economic relief measures to support workers, families and small businesses.

Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers maintain strong profit despite heightened wheat prices and marketing costs. Labor shortages and higher wages have led to increased automation, though it hasn't fully offset the wage costs.

Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers are strategically concentrated in the Mid-Atlantic, Great Lakes and West regions. The Mid-Atlantic and Southeast stand out for their significant manufacturing capabilities and close proximity to Canada.

When disposable income strengthens, the propensity for consumers to purchase discretionary goods, like frozen cake, pastry and related products, swells. High-income earners are more likely to purchase higher-priced premium frozen pastry and cake products. A per capita disposable income boost represents an opportunity for frozen cake and pastry manufacturers.

New York and California dominate this industry because of their large populations and key cities like Los Angeles County. Proximity to major inputs, large city markets and international trade routes heavily influence this distribution.

Demand for frozen cakes dominates, peaking in winter. Ingredient shortages have recently hindered expansion. Rising interest in specialty frozen pastries and a willingness to try new tastes have driven sales, however.

Strengthened e-commerce has benefited large supermarkets, allowing direct purchases from manufacturers and reducing wholesale demand. Retailers remain key players in sales; food establishments endure growth amid strengthened customer spending.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Grocery wholesalers primarily service supermarkets, convenience stores and other retails. Grocery wholesalers' revenue share has seen a drop recently because of a boost of online systems and e-commerce, allowing large supermarkets to buy directly from manufacturers.

Retailers, especially large supermarket chains and mass merchandisers, can purchase frozen products directly from manufacturers, bypassing middleman costs, which has boosted their contribution over the past five years.

Food service establishments include restaurants, hotels, hospitals and other catering institutions. While small to mid-size operators within this segment generally buy from wholesalers, larger establishments also hold the potential to buy directly from the manufacturers. COVID-19 pressured demand from this market segment, which was caused by the drop in consumer spending on hotels and restaurant meals because of reduced travel. However, demand from food service establishments has since returned amid heightened consumer spending.

products_and_services.product_description: The frozen cake segment is a significant contributor to industry revenue. Soft cakes like angel food cakes, cupcakes, sponge cakes and cheesecake sales comprise this segment.

This product segment includes other frozen pastry products, including doughnuts, creampuffs, eclairs and baked goods with wheat as the primary ingredient. Sales in this segment have strengthened over the past five years because of a boost in consumer preference for specialty or organic frozen baked goods.

Baking Mix & Prepared Food Production in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wheat, Barley & Sorghum Farming in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: When disposable income strengthens, the propensity for consumers to purchase discretionary goods, like frozen cake, pastry and related products, swells. High-income earners are more likely to purchase higher-priced premium frozen pastry and cake products.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Strengthening Of The Dollar Pushes Up The Cost Of Local Goods
international_trade_points.trade_description: The strengthened US dollar is driving up the cost of domestic goods. Consumers face higher prices as the local currency's value increases, affecting purchasing power.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Foreign Baked Good Trends Influence Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: Rising interest in international cuisines drives US consumers to purchase imported frozen cakes and pastries. This trend reflects a growing demand for diverse culinary experiences and supports the expansion of the global food market.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Fuel and Shipping Costs Impact Export Prices
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exporters must adopt innovative strategies to manage shipping costs and sustain their global market positions. Cutting-edge logistics, efficient supply chains and cost-effective transportation methods are critical for maintaining competitive advantages in the international marketplace.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) Has Fostered Robust Connections With Neighboring Countries
international_trade_points.trade_description: The USMCA, launched in 2020, reduced tariffs on many goods traded among the U.S., Canada and Mexico. This trade agreement aims to facilitate commerce and strengthen economic ties between the three North American countries.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic and Southeast regions lead in frozen cake and pastry manufacturing. These areas host the majority of industry activity and benefit from strategic positioning and infrastructure that support large-scale production.

The Mid-Atlantic and Southeast regions lead in frozen cake and pastry manufacturing. These areas host the majority of industry activity and benefit from strategic positioning and infrastructure that support large-scale production.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The USDA and FDA regulate frozen cake and pastry manufacturers to ensure products are safe and effective. They mandate truthful nutrition labeling and ingredient safety, adhering to the FD&C Act, the Fair Packaging and Labeling Act and the Food Safety Modernization Act.

The Environmental Protection Agency enforces environmental regulations on frozen cake and pastry manufacturers, requiring permits for pollutant discharge and outlining methods for waste disposal and pollution reduction.

The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) guarantees safe working conditions in this industry. It demands up-to-date equipment, proper training and safety gear. Employers must comply with these standards to ensure worker safety.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, which increases barriers to entry.

factors_decreased_barrier: Concentration level is low, decreasing barriers.
Technology change level is low, decreasing barriers.

basis_points.basis_description: Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers endure moderate to increasing competition in inputs, packaging, marketing and pricing.
Perceived quality drives pricing, with branded products often commanding higher prices because of their presumed superior quality.
External competition arises from supermarkets with in-house bakeries, independent bakeries and imports from Canada and Mexico.
Maintaining competitiveness requires securing optimal shelf space at retail outlets.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Leading frozen cake and pastry brands gaining share
concentration_points.concentration_description: Leading frozen cake and pastry brands are grasping higher market share, indicating a low level of market share concentration but increasing trend.
Multiple small acquisitions and organic growth have fueled the expansion of frozen cake and pastry manufacturers, boosting industry consolidation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: STRONG DEPRECIATION COSTS REFLECT SWELLING DEPENDANCE ON MACHINERY AMONG FROZEN CAKE AND PASTRY MANUFACTURERS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: This relative consistency indicates a strong reliance on automated machinery in the food manufacturing sector. More frequent use of these machines accelerates wear and tear, necessitating more maintenance and replacements.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: FREEZING DOESN'T MEAN COMPROMISING ON FLAVOR
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Recent marketing campaigns for frozen pastries claim these products match the freshness and flavor of refrigerated or shelf-stable options. The campaigns aim to reassure consumers about the quality of frozen pastries.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGE COSTS ARE STRENGTHENING BECAUSE OF LABOR SHORTAGES THAT PUSH AUTOMATION IN PRODUCTION
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Over the last five years, frozen cake and pastry manufacturers have turned to automation with machinery and equipment to streamline production processes and improve operational efficiency in response to strong labor costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Despite Strong Ingredient Prices and Marketing Expenditures, Profit Remains Steady
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The world price of wheat, an essential ingredient in baking, has surged over the past five years, driving up the cost of dough used for soft cakes and other pastries. To counter the perception that frozen cakes and pastries are less tasty or fresh than their shelf-stable or refrigerated counterparts, businesses have invested heavily in product innovation and marketing to maintain relatively high profit.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Frozen Cake and Pastry Manufacturing industry is moderately capital-intensive. It blends automated machinery with essential human labor, but the industry's reliance on human workers remains significant despite automation.
Health-Conscious and Inclusive Offerings Help Manufacturers Attract a Larger Consumer Base

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: UNIQUE AND INNOVATIVE VARIETIES CATERING TO MORE CONSUMERS HAVE GAINED POPULARITY
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Unconventional and unique flavors like matcha, lavender and exotic fruits are being incorporated into frozen cakes and pastries. There's also an emphasis on ethnic and international flavors, bringing a taste of various cultures to consumers' tables.

volatility_points.volatility_title: FROZEN CAKE AND PASTRY MANUFACTURERS ARE RIDING ON THE WAVE OF FLUCTUATING INGREDIENT PRICES
volatility_points.volatility_description: Frozen cake and pastry manufacturers experience significant revenue volatility because of fluctuating costs of key raw materials like wheat, sugar and fruit. These changes impact production costs and pricing.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Industry Manufacturers are also Forced to Navigate the Choppy Waters of Changing Consumer Preferences
volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumer tastes and dietary preferences can pivot rapidly, causing shifts in demand for products within the Frozen Cake and Pastry Manufacturing industry. Diet trends like low-carb and gluten-free movements have prompted a segment of consumers to limit or cut out bread-based products and sweets, impacting frozen cake and pastry manufacturers' revenue.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Large companies (i.e. Edwards, Mrs. Smith) have a broad portfolio of household known products. Healthier versions of classic favorite frozen pies with all natural ingredients have become very popular, providing expansion opportunities.

FAQs.question: Have exports offered an opportunity for your company?
FAQs.answer: Exports in this industry are low. An appreciating dollar causes domestic goods to be relatively more expensive in foreign markets, hurting exports.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Sugar and wheat prices have been volatile over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near important suppliers?
FAQs.answer: As frozen pie producers incorporate more fresh fruit into their products, it will be beneficial to be located near farms.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Wages are rising and represent 16.9% of industry revenue. Automation is important in order to maintain high and consistent levels of production on a daily basis.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to safeguard your company's proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Frozen cake and pastry goods don't vary substantially, however, companies that continue to innovate and create new flavor combinations will benefit the most.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses substantially impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The FDA closely monitors food production. Frozen cake and pastry producers will start phasing out most artificial ingredients from products over the next few years.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies must meet a range of federal safety requirements for their products. For example, frozen food producers must ensure that facilities producing products for consumption are free of hazardous contaminants.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Brand loyalty is important in bakery products. Consumers will continue to purchase their brand of choice despite price hikes.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Frozen cakes and pies are most popular throughout the winter months and the holiday season. Creating seasonally flavored pies with seasonal fruits is a way to combat this trend.

FAQs.question: Do you have secure contracts with trustworthy suppliers? How do you mitigate volatile input costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies generally have reliable contracts with suppliers of commodities, like flour, corn, wheat, potatoes and sugar, to reduce supply volatility.

FAQs.question: How do you respond to variability in consumer demand?
How do you differentiate your products from your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Successful producers are able to differentiate their products to maintain market share and boost sales. Brand recognition, quality and value are important considerations for potential customers.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to pass on cost hikes to consumers?
FAQs.answer: Successful manufacturers are able to pass on increasing input costs by raising their product prices without substantially lowering product demand.

FAQs.question: How do you demonstrate the value of your products even at a higher price point?
How closely do you track trends in healthy eating? Do you offer products that are lower in sugar?
FAQs.answer: Per capita sugar and sweetener consumption represents the amount of calories from sugars and sweeteners are consumed by US consumers.

FAQs.question: How does fluctuating healthy eating impact your company? How can you appeal to health-conscious consumers?
FAQs.answer: US consumers are becoming more aware of nutrition in their daily diets, shunning foods high in fat, sugar and carbohydrates. That's why health- and weight-conscious consumers typically shy away from frozen cake and pastry products, which often contain these undesirables.

FAQs.question: Do you offer products with premium ingredients? How can you prepare for an uptick in demand because of swelling per capita disposable income?
FAQs.answer: When disposable income strengthens, the propensity for consumers to purchase discretionary goods, like frozen cake, pastry and related products, swells. High-income earners are more likely to purchase higher-priced premium frozen pastry and cake products.
